definition[0]: someone who buys something expensive such as a house or car
definition[1]: someone whose job is to choose and buy the goods for a shop or company
example[2]: a buyer for a chain store
example[3]: After three weeks, the family had a buyer for their three-bedroomed home.
definition[3]: a phrase meaning that it is the responsibility of the person buying something to notice any faults that it may have
example[4]: ‘Let the buyer beware’ has long served as an ominous warning to home buyers and a cherished protection for sellers.
definition[4]: someone whose job is to buy the goods, materials etc for a shop to sell or a company to use
example[5]: A wholesale buyer of women’s clothing only inspects a sample of the goods.
